thread.title_full: H.S. girls gymnastics notes: New allegiance for Colangelo - Girls Gymnastics - NorthJersey.com

author: GREG TARTAGLIA
title: H.S. girls gymnastics notes: New allegiance for Colangelo - Girls Gymnastics
text:
Monday’s Clifton at Wayne Valley matchup featured a pair of opposing coaches who are Clifton alumnae.
Samantha Colangelo, who competed for the Mustangs before graduating in 2008, took over the program at Wayne Valley this season and led it to four wins in five meets, including a 97.975-82.925 victory over her alma mater.
"And I was an assistant coach at Clifton last year, too," Colangelo said.
Now in her second season leading the Mustangs, 2007 grad Brittany Gaccione has gotten steady performances from the Wong twins, seniors Samantha and Kristen, despite the team’s 0-5 start. Kristen Wong scored a season-high 33.0 all-around against Holy Angels last Thursday, and freshman Doriana Lacitignola has become a regular contributor on the floor, averaging in the high 7s.
TUESDAY MATINEE: The top four teams in The Record Super Six highlight today’s slate of meets, with No. 2 Ridgewood hosting No. 1 Ramapo at 4:30 p.m. The Green Raiders currently share the second-longest win streak in Bergen County history with Ridgewood, as their 50 straight victories have matched the Maroons’ run from 1976-80.
In Oakland, No. 3 Pascack Regional faces No. 4 Holy Angels in a tri-meet that also includes Indian Hills.
The Angels won their first-ever meeting with Pascack last year, 102.95-87.325, and posted their first victory of 2015 last Friday at Clifton. Pascack has won two in a row after an 0-2 start.
TUMBLING PASSES: Each of West Milford’s past two meets have been decided by 0.55 points. The Highlanders defeated Clifton last Wednesday, 87.2-86.65, and fell to Montclair on Monday, 96.85-96.3. ... Wayne Valley assistant coach Lesley Nugnes recently delved into the Indians’ record book and found that freshman Rachael Bussanich tallied the highest vault score in program history with her silver-medal 9.45 at last month’s Wayne Classic. ... Mahwah independent Stephanie Hunstein competed all-around for the first time this year at last Thursday’s Indian Hills-Ridgewood dual. The junior’s top effort was a 7.4 on vault.
